intro: Tonningia kewensis, commonly known as the Kew mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are fleshy and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Tonningia kewensis plays a role in forest ecosystems by influencing host tree growth and providing food for various wildlife species.
